Grenfell fire victims lacked common sense, Jacob Rees-Mogg suggests – video
05 Nov 2019, 11:49 by LBC



Jacob Rees-Mogg has apologised after claiming Grenfell Tower fire victims did not use 'common sense' and leave the burning building in spite of the London fire brigade's instructions to stay put. 
In a statement issued to the Evening Standard, the leader of the House of Commons, said: 'I profoundly apologise. What I meant to say is that I would have also listened to the fire brigade's advice to stay and wait at the time. However, with what we know now and with hindsight I wouldn't and I don't think anyone else would'


Grenfell inquiry has cost 100 times amount saved on cladding
